subNodes.conversationText: root

The common room of the Bonnyjoy Inn was crowded. A few dozen souls sat at tables and on one another's laps, leaned on posts, and slunk in corners, laughing, dancing, clapping, singing, falling asleep, and gossiping.
[Continue.]

The presence of so much human mirth so close to paths haunted by the Congress of Moths and kami might seem surprising. But the Bonnyjoy was built at the very edge of the wilderness, and company thrives at the edge of things.
[Continue.]

<FirstName> recognized a familiar face in the crowd. It was Jarum of the Grasses, whom <he/she> had met in the woods not long after setting out.

He saw the young witch too. He said something to the young man beside him and then grinned at <FirstName>.

He stood up, steadying himself as he did.
[Continue.]
"Good people of the Bonnyjoy!" he bellowed. He was flushed and clearly enjoying himself.
[Continue.]
The crowd quieted down and listened.
[Continue.]

"Another witch enters this house of good cheer! <He/She> is -- or is soon to be -- the protege of Eldest Lady herself. Let us honor <him/her>! There may be a king in Dudow, but the queen of the woods is Eldest Lady."
[Continue.]

Now the room went completely silent. Dudovians took their monarch very seriously, and Jarum seemed to be making light of the royal office.

Moreover, an unknown witch is not always a welcome addition to a scene of merriment.
[Continue.]
Jarum overlooked their lack of enthusiasm and went on: "That's right: two witches, one inn. Have you ever had two witches under this roof at once, innkeeper?"
[Continue.]
"I haven't been keeping track," said the innkeeper.
[Continue.]

"Not keeping track? But you must have many stories to tell. Write them all down -- Make a book of it -- Start taking notes, like this: 'Two witches -- one inn -- first witch handsome -- second witch... very clever'... You'll have to begin with something interesting or no one will ever read it."
[Continue.]
"I hope no one ever does. Sit down, please. No more speeches."
[Continue.]
Jarum did as he was told. The crowd began to talk again, but the young witch still commanded the attention of some of them.
<FirstName> looked embarrassed and said nothing.

No speech being forthcoming from the new witch, the guests returned to their chatter.

Jarum motioned for <FirstName> to join him.
[End.]
"I am here on grim business," <FirstName> announced. "I seek information about a murderer."

Silence again. If anyone knew anything, they did not see this as an opportunity to step forward.

Jarum motioned for <him/her> to come sit down with him and his friend.
[End.]
"Greetings, patrons of the Bonnyjoy! Let it be known that the newest witch is thirsty."

The crowd cheered, and conversation resumed.

A young woman soon came over with a flagon of wine, blushing as she handed it to <FirstName>, but she ran off as Jarum was motioning to <him/her> to come sit down, and <FirstName> couldn't thank her properly.
[End.]
